definition: zero/nought/zero sign/fractional/fragmentary/odd (of numbers)/(placed between two numbers to indicate a smaller quantity followed by a larger one)/fraction/(in mathematics) remainder (after division)/extra/to wither and fall/to wither
coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]

sentences.english: Could I trouble you for some change?
sentences.chinese: 麻煩你給我換些零錢好嗎？

sentences.english: The expression probably began because seeds fed to chickens made people think of small change.
sentences.chinese: 這一表達可能源自於雞食會令人們想到零錢。

sentences.english: Could you change me a one-pound note, please?
sentences.chinese: 能否請你換一鎊的零錢給我？

sentences.english: She rummaged some change out of her purse.
sentences.chinese: 她從錢包裏翻出了一些零錢。

sentences.english: People carry their phones around in pockets with keys and change.
sentences.chinese: 人們可以把他們的手機裝在裝有鑰匙及零錢的兜裏。

sentences.english: Press the amount you have to pay, insert your coins, and the ticket will come out.
sentences.chinese: 按下妳要買的票價，投入零錢，票就會跑出來了。

sentences.english: Sorry, I'm afraid I can't give change the banknote of 10 pounds, don't you have dibs?
sentences.chinese: 對不起，我找不開10英鎊的鈔票。您沒有零錢嗎？

sentences.english: Susan hunted through her purse for some change.
sentences.chinese: 蘇珊翻遍錢包找點零錢。

sentences.english: W:: Here're your stamps and envelops, and your changes.
sentences.chinese: 這是你的郵票和信封還有找你的零錢。

sentences.english: Where can I change some money to pay the taxi?
sentences.chinese: 我到哪裏去換零錢來付計程車車費？

sentences.english: Coffee cans are perfect for loose change.
sentences.chinese: 咖啡罐是最好的零錢罐。

sentences.english: This purchase by him happened after an interval of 13 years when he bought a truck with spare change.
sentences.chinese: 這是他事隔13年之後再次用存下來的零錢購車。

sentences.english: Don't forget to count your change.
sentences.chinese: 別忘了數一數你的零錢。

sentences.english: She poured all the change out on the floor and counted it carefully.
sentences.chinese: 她把所有的零錢都倒在地板上，仔細地數着。

definition: paper money/a bill (e.g. 100 yuan)/CL:張|张[zhang1],紮|扎[za1]
Octopus card (Hong Kong smart card for electronic payments)
money wrapped in red as a gift/bonus payment/kickback/bribe
to recharge (a battery)/(fig.) to recharge one's batteries (through leisure)/to update one's skills and knowledge
easily/without trouble/while one is at it/in passing/handy
